intro: Malachra kegeliana, commonly known as the Kegel's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Malachra kegeliana is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in full sun.
